trans-unit.source: Provides code to the page parser for assigning property values on a control.
The ResourceExpressionBuilder class creates code to retrieve resource values when the page is executed.
A resource file typically contains information localized for a particular language or culture.
A resource expression takes the form `<%$ Resources: ClassKey, ResourceKey %>` within the page.
The part of the expression before the colon (:) designates the type of expression builder to use, and the part after the colon signifies the class name and resource key.

The preceding expression would retrieve the following value from a file named `ClassKey.resx`: ``` <data name="ResourceKey"><value xml:space="preserve">Hello!</value></data> ``` When the page parser encounters an expression with the `Resources` prefix, it creates an instance of the ResourceExpressionBuilder class.
The ResourceExpressionBuilder class either evaluates the expression or generates code to return a value for the expression when the page is executed.
If the expression is encountered in a page that will be compiled, the ResourceExpressionBuilder object generates code that retrieves the specified value from the resource file.
If the expression is encountered in a page that will not be compiled, the ResourceExpressionBuilder object returns the value from the resource file when the page is parsed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionBuilder"></xref> class.
Returns a value from a resource file.
This method is called when an expression of the form `<%$ Resources: someResourceKey %>` is encountered in a page that uses the no-compile feature.
It retrieves the appropriate value from a key/value pair in a resource file.
The object containing the expression.
The object that represents information about the property bound to by the expression.
The object containing parsed data as returned by the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionBuilder.ParseExpression*> method.
Contextual information for the evaluation of the expression.
An <xref:System.Object> associated with the parsed expression.
The parsed expression contains the class name and resource key.
Returns a code expression to evaluate during page execution.
This method is called during the CodeDOM creation for a page or control.

The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeExpression> object returned is of the type <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMethodInvokeExpression> and represents the method to call when retrieving a resource value during page execution.
The property name of the object.
The parsed value of the expression.
Properties for the control or page.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that invokes a method.
Returns an object that represents the parsed expression.

This method parses the expression and returns a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> and a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A> property value in the returned <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields> object, if these properties are provided in the expression.
The expression value to be parsed.
The <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields"></xref> for the expression.
Returns an object that represents the parsed expression.
The returned <xref:System.Object> is of type <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields>.

This method parses the expression and returns a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey%2A> and a <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey%2A> property value in the returned <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields> object, if those properties are provided in the expression.
The value of the declarative expression.
The type of the property bound to by the expression.
Contextual information for the evaluation of the expression.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the parsed expression.
The resource expression cannot be found or is invalid.
Returns a value indicating whether an expression can be evaluated in a page that uses the no-compile feature.
The SupportsEvaluate property indicates whether the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionBuilder.EvaluateExpression%2A> method has been implemented in the class.

<xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionBuilder.EvaluateExpression%2A> must be implemented within an expression builder for an expression to be evaluated in a page that uses the no-compile feature.
<xref:System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionBuilder> supports evaluation of resource values in non-compiled pages, so this property always returns `true`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
